title: Geth stuck on block 13562308 because of gas discrepancy in block 13562309

body:
I suspect the solution here is the same as in https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/23613#issuecomment-923955349

>  Ok, so if you run `geth db delete 0x536e617073686f74526f6f74`, this will delete the database key which contains the state root of the snapshot. When Geth starts up and doesn't find this, it will start regenerating the entire snapshot, but will reuse any existing data. I'm certain that it will still take a good few hours even like this, but at least you'll have a functional node (generation will be done in the background) without needing a resync.

If you compile on master, you could also do `geth db delete SnapshotRoot`.
Did your node crash? Were you still generating the snapshot?
